title: Integrated Urban Solid Waste Management Program II
description: Improve the comprehensive management of Urban Solid Waste (RSU). The specific objectives of this operation are: (i) to increase the adequate disposal of RSU; (ii) improve the recovery and valuation of MSW with a perspective of social inclusion; (iii) mitigate the negative environmental impacts of open-air dumps.

title: Provincial Management Strengthening Program
description: The general objective of this operation is to contribute to growth and private sector employment in the provinces by improving the management of revenue, expenditure, and public investment, and by implementing investment projects. The interaction between strengthening actions and public investment projects will help to: (i) create incentives for improving fiscal management by linking it with project financing; and (ii) ensure that improvements in the management of provincial investment are implemented. The operation's specific objectives at the provincial level are to: (i) increase provincial revenue, with a focus on the real estate tax; (ii) improve the management and targeting of provincial public expenditure; (iii) strengthen investment management; (iv) finance investment projects in strategic sectors, increasing private sector employment; and (v) provide support in the design of fiscal federalism reforms.

title: Water and Sanitation Program for the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area and the Districts in the First, Second, and Third Rings of the Buenos Aires Conurbation - Tranche II
description: The general objective of the program is to contribute to improving the quality of life of the population that lives in the Metropolitan Area of the City of Buenos Aires and the Districts of the First, Second and Third Cordón of the Conurbano Bonaerense. The specific objectives are: (i) to increase the coverage of the residential sewage network service; (ii) reduce unaccounted-for water in distribution networks in intervened areas; (iii) reduce the impact of wastewater discharges from the Berazategui Plant in the Río de la Plata; and (iv) improve efficiency in the provision of Water and Sanitation (W&S) services.

title: Inst Improvement Prog for Productive Sector & Fiscal Admin in Provinces
description: The general objective of the program is to contribute to the institutional strenghtening at provincial level, by establishing a framework of medium- and long-term fiscal and financial sustainability, maintaining an adequate fiscal balance through action on both the expenditure and the revenue sides; strengthening and upgrading the GCBA' s public administration by: (i) enhancing the efficiency and transparency of its management functions, and (ii) encouraging the participation of civil society through decentralization and strengthening of the legislative body; and supporting the investment program to ensure satisfactory quality and coverage of public services.

title: Development of Satellite System and Applications Program
description: The Program's objective will be to contribute to the gathering, managing, and using of complete spatial information cycles with applications that contribute to the improvement of socio-economic conditions of the country. To achieve those objectives, and given the high-risk characteristics of the Program, the development of a risk mitigation strategy will be needed. The Team will have the initial elements of such a strategy once it receives the requested information from CONAE during the Identification Mission. Some of the elements of that strategy should include the creation of an Expert External Panel to advise the Bank in technical matters, present to the Bank a Management and Action Plan for the entire Program (timetables, budget, responsibilities, milestones, etc.), perform an exhaustive economic evaluation of the Program to estimate the potential ex-ante benefits of the potential applications and the development of feasible projects' profiles according to a potential applications sample that justifies the investment.

title: Connectivity and Safety Program for Road Corridors in the Province of Buenos Aires
description: The general objective of the program is to help make the PBA's economy more productive by improving road infrastructure. The specific objectives are to: (i) help improve the quality of traffic flow by expanding the capacity of sections of the PBA's main road network, and enhance road safety, which will decrease vehicle operation costs, travel times, and traffic accidents; and (ii) help improve road spending efficiency by strengthening road planning and asset management processes, improving road network operations, and strengthening preinvestment frameworks.

title: Technological Innovation Program III
description: The project¿s general objective is to increase investment in research, development, and innovation with the aim of boosting the competitiveness and productivity of enterprises.

title: Water and Sanitation Program for Urban and Suburban Centers (PAyS)
description: To contribute to solve the potable water and sanitation problematic in the main centers and urban agglomerates of the country in order that the users who count on that service improve their quality of life and that the families who do not count on this one can get to have it in the short term.

title: Program to support the equity and effectiveness of the social safety net in Argentina
description: The general objective of the program is to help make social safety net programs in Argentina sustainable and more effective. Specifically, the program seeks to: (i) ensure the sustainability of cash transfer programs aimed at the vulnerable population in the context of the targets agreed upon by the Argentine government and the International Monetary Fund; (ii) promote the need to stay in and complete school as well as comprehensive job training for the beneficiary population of these transfers; (iii) boost the distributive efficiency of subsidies on public services; and (iv) enhance the efficiency of social safety net programs by their information management capacity of the data generated in program execution

title: Social Development Provincia de Córdoba
description: Support the the Province of Cordoba in the implementation of its social development policy in three prioritiy sectors: education, health and social housing.

title: Support Program for Small Wine Producers in Argentina II (PROVIAR II)
description: The general objective of the Program is to contribute to the social, economic and environmental sustainability of Argentine viticulture, in particular, of small and medium producers, viticultural establishments and rural youth. As specific objectives, the program proposes to: (i) improve the productivity levels of small and medium wine producers with a focus on efficiency in the use of water resources; (ii) increase the sales of small and medium-sized wine establishments; and (iii) strengthen small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in the rural sector to generate employment and increase sales with a focus on youth and women.

title: Contingent Loan for Natural Disaster Emergencies - Support for the Flood Emergency Response in Bahía Blanca
description: The general objective of development is to help mitigate the impact that a severe or catastrophic natural disaster could have on the country's public finances. The specific objective of development is to improve the financial management of natural disasters by increasing stable, cost-efficient, and rapidly accessible contingent financing to cover extraordinary public expenses aimed at assisting the population affected by natural disasters. This financing will support government actions in response to the flood emergency in the City of Bahía Blanca and surrounding areas affected by one of the most extreme climate events in the region.

title: First individual operation under the CCLIP Urban Development and Habitat Improvement Program of Neuquen
description: The overall objective of this first individual operation is to contribute to sustainable and inclusive urban development in the province of Neuquén. Its specific objectives are: (i) to comprehensively improve established urban areas; (ii) to promote the formalization and urban development of popular neighborhoods and slums; and (iii) to strengthen sustainable urban and territorial management.

title: Digital Transformation of Mendoza’s Health System
description: To drive the digital transformation of Mendoza's health system by enhancing its capacity to generate, integrate, and use health and economic information in digital format. The project aims to: (i) improve the timeliness and quality of clinical care; (ii) increase efficiency and equity in resource allocation; and (iii) promote a more personalized and proactive model of care, based on population-level data analytics and evidence to anticipate needs and guide public health interventions.

title: Additional Financing Norte Grande Electricity Transmission Program
description: The main objective of the Project is to guarantee the coverage of the increasing power demand and the security of the Argentinean Interconnection System (SADI), with the object of contributing to the continuous development of the productive sectors and elevating the standard of life of the population, by rationally making use of the available generation resources of the country. The specific objectives are: i) to interconnect the electrical systems of the Northeast and Northwest Argentinean regions (NOA ¿ NEA) by using a line of extra high tension (LEAT 500kV and associated Transformation Stations) so it can permit and promote the energy exchange between both regions, improving the prices and increasing the quality and security of the electrical provision, in particular for the macro region of Norte Grande; and ii) to consolidate and expand the regional communication nets (high and med tension lines smaller than 500kV with its respective associated transformation stations), laying the foundations for the productive and social development through giving solution to the problems that attempt against the security and reliability of these systems.

title: DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM FOR METROPOLITAN AREAS OUTSIDE THE CAPITAL II
description:
The objective of the conditional credit line for investment projects (CCLIP) is to enhance the quality
of life of the population in metropolitan areas by improving urban services and infrastructure. The objective of the first individual operation
is to improve public services and infrastructure in metropolitan areas that require cooperation between two or more territorial jurisdictions
by: (i) fostering an understanding of the problems facing big cities and promoting agreements to prioritize actions that require coordination
between municipal and provincial authorities of a metropolitan area; (ii) contributing to build the institutions necessary to deliver services
and infrastructure in metropolitan areas that encompass two or more territorial jurisdictions; and (iii) financing investments in urban
infrastructure and facilities to support such improvements.

title: Institutional Strengthening Program for the National Senate
description: The general objective of the program is to support the institutional strengthening of the Argentine Senate so as to improve its parliamentary and administrative management capacity in the context of greater transparency. The program has four components: (i) support for parliamentary management and the lawmaking process; (ii) administrative and financial management of the Senate; (iii) human resources management, optimization, and training; and (iv) change management and public information.

title: Improvement of the Competitiveness of Tourism
description: The main objective of the project is to increase revenues generated by visitors to prioritized public tourism areas.

title: Norte Grande Competitiveness Program
description: To increase productive chains competitiveness in the Provinces that are part of the Argentinean NOA-NEA (Norte Grande Region), through the establishment of an institutional mechanism which supports development of these productive chains showing verifiable increases in the competitiveness of the participating companies measured through increases on exports, productivity improvements, increases in dynamic market sales, etc. The purpose consists of implementing a Program that will include components which will support development, with efficient and transparent procedures, promoting associated work between companies, generally through promoter entities present in the nucleuses and/or circuits of economic activity within the region.

title: Project to Integrate Small Producers into the Wine Production Chain
description: To improve the profitability and the income sustainability of small primary producers within the grape & wine chain. Project's purpose is to attain a better and bigger integration of the actors within the grape and wine chain.

title: Federal Power Transmission Program (PFTEE)
description: The general objective of the first operation is to contribute to the decarbonization of the electricity sector by reducing Green House Gas (GHG) emissions and improving human development through the expansion and modernization of electricity transmission systems.

title: Program to Support Public Policies for the Sustainable and Resilient Growth of Argentina II
description: The general development objective is to contribute to sustainable and resilient growth in Argentina. The specific development objectives are: (i) to strengthen the government's capacity to plan and finance climate action; (ii) promote policies that contribute to the circular economy and decarbonization; and (iii) develop a favorable framework for sustainable finance.

title: Strengthening of the Economic Policy Secretariat
description: The project objective is to contribute to the institutional strengthening process of the economic policy and the national development strategy. Specifically, the operation will improve the institutional capacity of the Economic Policy Secretariat for: (i) policy formulation; (ii) economic and social development strategies; and (ii) policy implementation as well as sectoral coordination.

title: Technological Modernization Program III
description: This program seeks to continue supporting the improvement of the scientific and technological capacity of the country; promote the undertaking of innovation activities in private firms; promote the development of high-level human resources in science and technology; support cluster development; and promote an improvement in the relevance and capacity of the country's key research centers.

title: Strenghtening the Basic Health Care Strategy (FEAPS)
description: The primary objective of the Program is to support the improvement of the population's health, through the strengthening of the primary health care strategy as a system organizer. The specific objectives of the Program are: (i) strengthen the health planning capacities of the Ministry of Health and Environment of the Nation and the Provincial Ministries; and (ii) strengthen the Health Integral Service Network with emphasis on first and second delivery level.

title: SMEs Credit Access and Competitiveness Program
description: The objective of the Operation is to contribute to the improvement of the competitiveness and the increase of local value added on the argentinean SMEs, through the promotion of credit access for medium and long term investments and the external professional services. Also the Program will redesign and fortify a network of local institutions of promotion of the SMEs.

title: Logistics Infrastructure Program for the Regional Integration of Salta: Bioceanic Corridor
description: Strengthen road connectivity to promote international trade in the province of Salta

title: Solid Waste Management Program for Touristic Municipalities
description: The objective of the program is to provide infrastructure and improve the local capacity to provide GIRSU services in national parks and surrounding municipalities, as well as in other touristic municipalities that lay outside of the provincial solid waste collection network.

title: Program to Support a Policy on Improving Equity in Education
description: To support the implementation of the Education Financing Law and the General Education. Those laws are the basis of the Argentinean education strategy for the next five years. The specific objectives are: (i) quality improvement; (ii) to assure access and completion of basic and secondary education for kids from the poorer families; (iii) increase in the school day for schools in poorer areas; (iv) higher completion rates in secondary education; and (v) improvements in learning and use of information technology and communication. The specific activities include, scholarships, textbooks and education materials, school improvement projects in schools located in poorer neighborhoods; financing of school infrastructure and equipment; and upgraded of school facilities.

title: Program to support gender equality policies
description: The objective of the programmatic series is to help reduce gender inequality in Argentina, by fostering the effective and timely implementation of policies to enhance equality of opportunity and promote the rights of women and girls. The objectives of this first operation are to help reduce gender inequality in Argentina by strengthening the regulatory and institutional framework for promoting the physical and economic autonomy of women and improving government capacity to mainstream gender policies.

title: Program to Support Transparency and Integrity Reforms in Argentina II
description: The objective of the program is to contribute to the transparency and integrity of public management through regulations and mechanisms to promote access to information. This second operation will deepen progress in the following areas: (i) regulation of the legislation on access to public information and consolidation of the rules for ethical conduct of public officials; (ii) consolidation of the regulations and mechanisms for management of State resources in relation to public works contracting, public procurement, and public sector employment; and (iii) management of the financial sector. This is the second of two consecutive operations that are linked technically but financed independently under the programmatic policy-based loan (PBP) modality.

title: Macroeconomic Stability Support Program
description: The general objective of development is to strengthen Argentina's balance of payments. The specific development objective of this operation is to improve the monetary and exchange rate policy framework.

title: Program to Support Productive Infrastructure Financing in Argentina
description: The objective of the program is to promote private participation in productive investment to contribute to economic growth in Argentina. The program will help mitigate the risks that inhibit private financing for productive development through: (i) attracting a significant volume of private investment (institutional investors, international investors and other national or multilateral institutions); and (ii) promote efficient financing of a portfolio of private productive infrastructure projects, which matches the investors' performance, risk and term needs with the long-term needs of the projects.

title: Program to Support the National Early Childhood Plan and the Policy for Universalization of Early Childhood Education II
description: The multisector objective of the CCLIP is to contribute to increasing the number of children from 0 to 5 years of age who reach a level of physical, language and communication and socio-emotional skills expected for their age. The second operation of the CCLIP aims to increase the coverage and quality of institutions and public care and education services aimed at promoting the development of physical, language and communication, cognitive and socio-emotional skills of children from 0 to 5 years old .

title: Credit Program for the Reactivation of Production in the Province of Neuquen
description: The general development objective of the program is to contribute to the recovery of production and support the sustainability of employment in the Province of Neuquén. The specific development objective of the program is to provide beneficiary Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) that operate in the Province of Neuquén with productive financing.

title: Provincial Agricultural Services Program V - PROSAP V
description: The general objective of the Program is to contribute to the improvement of productivity, marketing and added value in Argentine agro-industrial production, with a focus on adaptation to climate change. The specific objectives are: (i) increase the coverage and quality of public infrastructure services in the areas to be intervened; and (ii) increase the adoption of technologies that promote economic profitability and environmental sustainability, and increase the adoption of product differentiation tools.

title: Comprehensive Early Childhood Development Program
description: The general development objective of the operation is to contribute to the reduction of extreme poverty among Argentinean children and to improve early childhood development indicators for vulnerable households. The project's specific objectives are: (i) improve the consumption protection capacity of cash transfer programs for low-income households with dependent children; (ii) increase effective access to public services aimed at promoting early childhood development; and (iii) improve the quality of a set of social benefits aimed at promoting early childhood development.

title: Support for the Transition Towards a Sustainable Electricity Sector in Argentina
description: The general development objective of the program is to strengthen the sustainability of the electricity sector by improving the targeting scheme to protect the electricity consumption of vulnerable users. The specific objectives are: (i) support the affordability of electricity service for vulnerable households in the AMBA; and (ii) strengthen institutional capacities for the sustainability of the electricity sector.

title: Program to Enhance the Management Capacity of the Federal Administration of Public Revenue
description: The objectives of the program are: (i) to strengthen tax collection, customs and social security contributions by reducing compliance costs; and (ii) improve service and attention to the taxpayer and foreign trade operators.

title: Satellite Technology Development Program (PROSAT II)
description: The program's general objective is to help increase the effectiveness of public policies for managing disaster risk, enhancing productivity, and improving the productive performance of sectors that use satellite monitoring. Its specific objectives are to: (i) improve the monitoring and response capacity of government agencies responsible for disaster risk prevention and management by providing satellite images using synthetic aperture radar (SAR) technology; and (ii) improve satellite information to support the performance of productive sectors that use the specific applications developed through the program

title: Emergency Program for an Immediate Response to the Flooding in Argentina
description:
The program's objective is to collaborate with the government's
efforts to restore infrastructure and basic services affected by the
heavy rains that caused varying degrees of flooding in seven
provinces along Argentina's coast In particular, the program aims to support the affected population's
transition to recovery of its regular social and economic activities by
rehabilitating road infrastructure such as roads and highways; water
infrastructure related to flood defense systems; public structures,
such as damaged schools and public buildings appropriate as
evacuation centers. It also intends to help reestablish basic utilities
such as water and electricity service in affected areas; and lastly, to contribute to the cleanup efforts in areas capable of enhancing
vector effects.

title: Technological Innovation Program IV
description: The program¿s general objective is to boost enterprise productivity by increasing investment in research, development, and innovation. The specific objectives are to: (i) increase the innovation capacity of enterprises; (ii) increase the generation of scientific and technological knowledge; and (iii) boost the capacity to monitor, evaluate, coordinate, and disseminate science, technology, and innovation policies.

title: Fiscal Policy Strengthening Program
description: The general development objective of the Program is to contribute to the fiscal sustainability of Argentina. The specific development objectives will be: (a) increase the efficiency of the tax system; and (b) increase the allocative efficiency of public spending.

title: Comprehensive Improvement of GRAL Roca Railway Project, Plaza Constitucion-La Plata Branch": reformulation and additional financing
description: The general objective of the project is to promote the recovery of metropolitan railways, contributing to the improvement of public transport services in the Metropolitan Region of Buenos Aires (RMBA) and the quality of life of the population, through the renewal and electrification of the passenger rail service of the Plaza Constitución - La Plata branch of the Roca Railway, increasing the modal share of this railway branch in the passenger transport of the Buenos Aires - La Plata corridor. The specific objectives are: (i) reduce travel times; (ii) reduce accident levels; (iii) improve the reliability and comfort of the service; and (iv) reduce Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions from the railway branch.

title: Development Program for Metropolitan Areas Outside the Capital
description: Contribute to the urban development of the metropolitan areas of the inner part of the country.

title: Support for Regulatory Reforms for Competitiveness Program
description: The general development objective of this operation is to improve the business environment to contribute to increasing the country's competitiveness through the following specific development objectives: (i) reducing the regulatory compliance costs of companies with the State; (ii) reducing the participation of national public companies in the economy; and (iii) increasing the efficiency of foreign trade operations.

title: Social Investment Program in Buenos Aires Province
description: The Program's objective is to improve the coverage of services in Education, Health and Human Development, particularly those services targeted to the poorest residents in the Province of Buenos Aires

title: Norte Grande Electricity Transmission Program
description: The main objective of the Project is to guarantee the coverage of the increasing power demand and the security of the Argentinean Interconnection System (SADI), with the object of contributing to the continuous development of the productive sectors and elevating the standard of life of the population, by rationally making use of the available generation resources of the country. The specific objectives are: i) to interconnect the electrical systems of the Northeast and Northwest Argentinean regions (NOA  NEA) by using a line of extra high tension (LEAT 500kV and associated Transformation Stations) so it can permit and promote the energy exchange between both regions, improving the prices and increasing the quality and security of the electrical provision, in particular for the macro region of Norte Grande; and ii) to consolidate and expand the regional communication nets (high and med tension lines smaller than 500kV with its respective associated transformation stations), laying the foundations for the productive and social development through giving solution to the problems that attempt against the security and reliability of these systems.

title: CCLIP: Water and Sanitation Program for the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area
description: To contribute to the development of the water supply and sanitation infrastructure and the stregthening of AySA as a public service institution.

title: Infraestructura Vial Productiva II
description: The main objectives of the Program include: strengthening the provincial productive road networks, connect local production areas with the national highway network in order to improve access to consumer centers, improve regional interchange, support economic growth, consolidate the reactivation of the productive sector, contribute to reduce poverty and unemployment and strengthen the regional institutions in charge of the road sector.

title: Support for Plan Familias I
description:
The program will be divided into three components:
Component 1. Conditional cash transfers. The program will finance conditional cash transfers for poor families.
Component 2. Non-monetary subsidies. Two activities will be financed: (i) workshops regarding adult education, nutrition, infant work eradication, health, and social organization and (ii) after school programs for children.
Component 3. Institutional Strengthening: The development and strengthening of the following systems will be financed: (i) control of conditionalities and registry, (ii) subsidy payment, (iii) monitoring, (iv) evaluation and (v) social risks.

title: Productive and export Development Program for the Province of Salta
description: The general objective of the program is to promote sustainable economic growth in the province of Salta, through the strengthening of sectors with growth potential, generation of knowledge, employment and internationalization. Specific objectives: (i) improve the competitiveness and internationalization of companies in the priority sectors through investments in infrastructure and the provision of financing, (ii) increase the availability of people trained with the skills required by companies in the prioritized sectors, and (iii) strengthen the capacity of the province in the implementation of a strategy to promote exports and investment attraction.

title: Norte Grande Roads Infrastructure Program
description: The general objective of the Program is to sustainably improve terrestrial transportation of freight and passengers in the priority corridors, for incrementing the competitiveness of the regional production structure and support economic and social integration of its inhabitants. The purpose of the Program is to reduce the costs of transport and time of travel, complimenting the improvement and rehabilitation of integration corridors with neighbor countries and of national and priority provincial routes that connect the nucleus and circuits of the region's economic activity with local and external markets, increasing security for the users of such routes.

title: MULTISECTORIAL PREINVESTMENT PROGRAM IV (CCLIP)
description: The objective of the program is to increase the efficiency, optimal allocation, and the productivity of the public investment that contributes to the economic and social developments of the country through the elaboration of general and specific pre-investment studies.

title: Integrated Urban Solid Waste Management Program.
description: The program objective is to decrease the disposal of urban solid waste (USW) in open dumps, and to increase its disposal in properly designed, built, and operated sanitary landfills in urban and tourism centers, and to increase its recovery and reuse. The program will finance actions and initiatives for education and awareness-raising; for separation at the source; and for the collection, transportation, transfer, recovery, recycling, and final disposal of USW, geared toward promoting integrated solid waste management, and benefitting some 975,000 households with improved collection and final disposal services.

title: Development of Tourism Corridors
description: The program's goal is to increase tourism expenditure, improving the spatial and temporal tourist exploitation of protected areas and their associated tourism destinations.

title: Provincial Agricultural Services II-PROSAP II
description: To support the process of productive development in the provincial economies of the rural sector, through the increase in public investment in productive infrastructure and agricultural services, together with incentives to private investments.

title: Cybersecurity for Critical Information Infrastructure Program
description: Contribute to the reduction of cybersecurity incident costs for the State and citizens

title: Support Program to Improve Fiscal Management and Economic Recovery
description: The overall development objective of the program is to support economic and social recovery in Argentina. The specific development objectives are: (i) strengthen public finances; (ii) contribute to price stability; and (iii) strengthen the balance of payments.

title: Program for the Strengthening of Agricultural Health Services and the Sustainable Management of Maritime Resources in Argentina (PROSAMA)
description: he general objective of the program is to promote the productivity, sustainability and climate resilience of agri-food and marine systems, with a focus on technological innovation. The specific objectives are: (i) to improve the effectiveness of surveillance, control, and prevention of the introduction of pests and diseases that affect the country's zoo-phytosanitary heritage; (ii) increase the diagnostic capabilities of plant and animal health laboratories, and improve quality control of agrifood products; (iii) improve the quality of certification services, payments, and procedures offered by the National Service for Agrifood Health and Quality (SENASA); and (iv) improve research capabilities on oceanographic resources, marine ecosystems, and the coastline.

title: Support for Vulnerable Populations through the Argentine Plan to Combat Hunger amid the COVID-19 Pandemic.
description: Contribute to the implementation of the "Argentina Against Hunger" Plan to prioritize early childhood and ensure the feeding and nutrition of families in social vulnerability with young children.

title: Strengthen the Ministry of Foreign Relations, International Trade and Worship II
description: The objective of the program is to improve the institutional performance of the MRECIC in the areas of operational management, trade promotion, and attraction of investments, to help increase participation by small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in foreign trade activities.

title: Food and Agriculture Health and Quality Management Program (CLIPP)
description: The Program will have five components: i) animal health, with the purpose of strengthening the permanent epidemic surveillance services, risk analysis, traceability and sanitary emergency, animal quarantine, animal health lab services; ii) plant health, includes the permanent phytosanitary surveillance services, monitoring and plague risk analysis, phytosanitary quarantine and phytosanitary labs; iii) food harmlessness, it is comprised by certification, food and agriculture quality, control of vegetal originated products and control of animal originated products including fishery products; iv) institutional management, with the purpose of assuring the continuous quality of the health services, while adhering to the guidance of experts and to the experience of the SENASA, the local entity in charge of health and quality of food and agriculture; and v) regional agricultural health and quality integration.

title: CCLIP: Program of Technological Innovation
description: To contribute to enterprises competitiveness and to the improvement of population quality of life through the country's science, technology and innovation development.

title: First Operation of the Program to Build Capacity and Improve Safety on the Accesses to the Cristo Redentor Border Crossing
description: The objective of the first operation is to improve service quality on the CRSC by reducing travel times and transportation costs through the construction of bypass roads in urban areas and supplementary safety-related works

title: Digital Health Agenda of the Health System of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires
description: The general development objective of the project is to contribute to improving timely, comprehensive and continuous access to public health services in the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires (CABA). The specific objective of the project is to improve the timeliness, comprehensiveness and quality with which the health information generated by the City is produced, shared and analyzed.

title: Water Infrastructure: Northern Provinces Development
description: The objective of this project is to contribute to the development of the northern provinces through the efficient utilization of water resources by regulating its availability for expanding both the agricultural and industrial sectors. Additionally the program will provide clean water and better sewage systems for low income populations and control flooding.

title: Drainage and Flood Control Project in the Province of Buenos Aires
description: The objective of the project is to better protect the population from flood risks and reduce the economic costs associated with these events. This objective will be achieved by implementing structural and nonstructural measures.

title: Water Resources Management and Aqueducts in Provinces of Argentina Program
description: The objective of the CCLIP is to contribute to improving water security in Argentina. The general objective of the first operation is to contribute to improving the quality of life of the population that lives in priority basins in Argentina, by improving the comprehensive management of Water Resources (HR) considering aspects of resilience to climate change. The specific objectives of the first operation will be: (i) increase the availability of water in the priority basins of the Argentine territory, under a multipurpose use approach, and increase and/or improve access to Potable Water (AP) services for human consumption; and (ii) improve HR planning and management capabilities.

title: Technological Innovation Program V
description:
The objective of the Conditional Credit Line for Investment Projects (CCLIP) is to strengthen Argentina's
innovation system and bring it to full institutional maturity. The general objective of the fifth and final individual operation under the CCLIP is to
boost enterprise productivity and competitiveness by supporting research, development, and innovation. The specific objectives are to:
(i) increase the technological innovation capacity of Argentine enterprises; (ii) increase the capacity of science and technology research;
and (iii) boost the capacity to monitor, evaluate, coordinate, and disseminate science, technology, and innovation (STI) policies.

title: Multiphase Development Infrastructure: Support Production Entre Rios
description: Contribute to the development and competitiveness of the economy of the province of Entre Ríos. El Gobierno de Entre Ríos (GdER) identificó 4 (cuatro) subsectores de intervención: (i) el sector vial, con el mejoramiento y pavimentación de 200km de tramos de carreteras; (ii) el sector eléctrico, con la construcción de la Estación Transformadora "Gran Paraná" de 500 / 132 kV, del denominado "Cierre Norte" del Sistema de transmisión de 132 kV, y obras complementarias; (iii) el sector portuario-fluvial, con la elaboración de un Plan Maestro del Sistema de Puertos de la provincia, incluyendo un programa de inversiones y un plan de negocios para viabilizar los proyectos portuarios prioritarios; y (iv) el sector productivo, a través del fortalecimiento de las cadenas de valor.

title: Program for the Techonolgical Development of Mendoza
description: The Program will promote the technological development of the Mendozan economy, based on innovation, qualified human resources, and the necessary infrastructure to improve the diversification of production and the strengthening of local economic activity.

title: Forest Sustainability and Competitiveness Program
description: The objective of the project is to contribute to the sustainable management and competitiveness of forest plantations by raising product quality in both primary production and initial processing, diversifying the productive base, and improving access to supply chains and markets for micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs).

title: Water and Sanitation Services Development Program – Belgrano Plan
description: The objective of the program is to increase access to water and sanitation services, while improving the operational and financial performance of service operators, mainly in the provinces covered by the Belgrano Plan. The specific objectives are: (i) to expand water and sewer service coverage; (ii) to optimize environmental, public health, and hygiene conditions through wastewater treatment; and (iii) to improve the management capacity of water and sanitation service operators.

title: MULTIPHASE PRIMARY HEALTH CARE PROGRAM FOR MANAGING CHRONIC NONCOMMUNICABLE DISEASES
description:
The objective of this second operation is to help reduce morbidity and mortality caused by chronic
noncommunicable diseases in Argentina, prioritizing the population with public coverage only. Specifically, this operation proposes to
help: (i) prioritize the primary care level as the gateway to the health care system; (ii) increase the population's access to screenings
for classification according to health risk; and (iii) increase access to timely treatment for those with moderate or high health risk suffering
from chronic conditions.

title: Lending Program for Productive Development in the Province of San Juan
description: The program aims to continue supporting the efforts of the provincial government to promote the productive private sector development through: i) the expansion of the flow of financial resources earmarked for commercial banks for medium and long term credit to MSMEs and ii) the consolidation of the supply of goods and nonfinancial services provided by the San Juan Agency for Investment Development to improve the competitiveness of recipient firms.

title: Social and Urban Integration Program in Greater Buenos Aires
description: The general objective of the CCLIP and its first operation is to improve living conditions in shantytowns, informal neighborhoods, and housing complexes in the Province of Buenos Aires through social and urban integration interventions. The specific objectives of the first operation are to: (i) strengthen and support local and provincial governments in the planning, management, and execution of comprehensive informal neighborhood intervention and regularization projects; (ii) improve access to and facilitate the use of basic utilities, resilient urban infrastructure, public spaces, community facilities, and government services for the residents of these neighborhoods, thereby integrating them into the municipal urban fabric; and (iii) strengthen social capital, increase opportunities for social, labor, and productive community development, and improve habitability and tenure conditions

title: Science and Technology Scholarships - Program BEC.AR
description: To increase the supply of highly-skilled human resources in strategic areas for promoting enterprise innovation.

title: Immediate Public Health Response Project en the context of the COVID-19 Pandemic to contain, control and mitigate its effect in health service provision in Argentina
description: The overall objective of this project is to help reduce morbidity and mortality from COVID-19 and mitigate the other indirect health effects of the pandemic. The project will have four specific objectives: (i) Strengthen the response response at the country level; (ii) Improve the detection and monitoring of cases; (iii) Support efforts to interrupt the chain of transmission of the disease; and (iv) Improve the capacity to provide services.

title: Export Promotion Program
description: Support the country's technical capacity to promote exports and attract investment in a coordinated, systematic and sustainable way (with a focus on result-based management and income generation).

title: Program for Strengthening of the Digital Agenda: Connectivity, Electronic Government and Digital Productive Transformation
description: The general objective of the program is to improve the productivity of theArgentine economy by advancing its digitalization through actions to: (i) establish a digital agenda;(ii) strengthen the legal framework for connectivity; (iii) broaden offerings and improve the quality of digitalgovernment services; and (iv) promote policy measures for digital productive transformation.This loan operation is the first in a programmatic series of two consecutive, single-tranche operations thatare technically related but financed independently under the programmatic policy-based loan (PBP)modality.

title: Program for Rural Development and Family Agriculture, PRODAF
description: The objective is to increase the income of family farmers by increasing productivity.

title: Program to Improve Water Services in the Province of Buenos Aires
description: The general objective of the Program is to contribute to improving the quality of life of the population living in the PBA through the provision of PC services. The specific objectives are: (i) to improve the quality and operational capacity of PC services; and (ii) improve the management of ABSA and the provincial entities linked to the W&S service.

title: Credit Program for the Reactivation of Production in the Province of San Juan
description: The general objective of the program is to contribute to the recovery of production in the Province of San Juan and to support the sustainability of MSMEs as a source of employment in the province. The specific objective is to promote the economic recovery of MSMEs that operate in the Province of San Juan through the provision of productive financing.

title: Program to Support the Policy on Improving Equity in Education-PROMEDU II
description: i) Improve retention and graduation rates in secondary level; (ii) increase the access to pre-school and secondary levels; (iii) expansion of school hours in primary level; and (iv) improvement of education management processes.

title: Support Program for Knowledge Economy Exports
description: The objective of the program is to contribute to the increase in exports of the Knowledge Economy sectors(EDC) through the provision of specialized human capital, the development and adoption of technologies based onArtificial Intelligence (AI) and the promotion of its international insertion.. The specific objectives are: (i) strengthen the formation of human capital required by the EDC sectors; (ii) increase collaboration between the technological scientific system and the productive sector in technologies based on Artificial Intelligence (AI); and (iii) contribute to the internationalization of companies in the EDC sectors.

title: Development, Investment, and Facilitation Program for Argentine Nature Tourism: the Nature Route
description: The general objective of the program i to increase tourist spending in natural areas of tourist interest, as well as their associated destinations.

title: Program of Strengthening and Integration of Health Networks of the Province of Buenos Aires
description: The objective of the CCLIP is to help improve the delivery capacity and quality of primary, secondary, and tertiary public health care services in the PBA, integrating them as a service network that provides priority care to people with exclusive public coverage in order to reduce the number of years of potential life lost. The objective of the first operation under the CCLIP is to improve access and effective coverage of public health services for the PBA population. Its specific objectives are to: (i) improve access to and the effectiveness of primary care in a set of municipios in the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area; (ii) increase the responsiveness of emergency services across the PBA; and (iii) dispense cancer and palliative drugs in a more timely manner across the PBA.

title: Development Programme's Norte Grande provinces: W&S Infrastructure
description: The objective of the program is to improve water and sanitation sector service and efficiency in the provinces of the Norte Grande of Argentina by financing projects to: (i) increase coverage and improve potable water and sanitary and stormwater sewerage services in unserved or underserved areas; and (ii) strengthen sector entities in the provinces, and improve service provider operational and financial efficiency and management.

title: Project to Improve the Provincial Route 82 Corridor in the Province of Mendoza
description: The general objective of the project is to help boost the productivity of the economy of the province of Mendoza by improving road and tourism infrastructure. The specific objectives are: (i) to help improve the quality of traffic flow and road safety by increasing capacity, rehabilitating, and upgrading the Provincial Route 82 corridor, which will result in reduced operating costs, shorter average travel times, and lower road accident rates; and(ii) to help improve the tourism competitiveness of the Cacheuta district through interventions in urban infrastructure and capacity-building in land use and tourism management in this district.

title: Water and Sanitation Program for Metropolitan Areas
description: The objective of the program is to expand coverage and improve management of water and sanitation services in the country¿s major urban centers and cities of more than 50,000 inhabitants. This objective is to be achieved by: (i) helping to make water and sanitation service providers more efficient and sustainable; (ii) undertaking renovation, rehabilitation, upgrading, and expansion works for water and sewer services; and (iii) supporting ENOHSA and strengthening the planning and regulatory functions of subnational entities.

title: Citizen Security and Inclusion Program
description: To attend the implementation of an innovating Program in the matter of Citizen Security, with a multifocal criterion, based on the inclusion like axis for the diminution of the social confliction in the Province of Buenos Aires. This boarding aims at the marginal conglomerates where the most vulnerable population exists.

title: Municipal Strengthening Program
description: EN

title: Program for Implementation of the National System for the Argentine International Trade Single Window
description:
The general objective of the program is to improve the international competitive positioning of the productive sector by designing and
implementing a technology platform for rules, regulations, and processes to simplify and facilitate international trade and foreign
investment operations: the Argentine International Trade Single Window, known by its Spanish-language acronym, VUCEA. The specific
objectives are: (i) to optimize the country's international trade processes through improvement of the rules and regulations, processes,
technologies, and human resources of the public and private institutions involved; (ii) to reduce international trade-related times and
costs; (iii) to deliver up-to-date information and services offered by public and private institutions involved in the country's trade facilitation
and trade promotion processes; (iv) to strengthen those entities technically and institutionally for sustainable operation of the VUCEA;
and (v) to facilitate interoperability of the VUCEA with the international trade platforms of other countries.

title: Program to Support Fiscal Sustainability and Growth
description: The general development objective of the program is to support the recovery of Argentina's macroeconomic sustainability. The specific development objectives are: (i) strengthen public finances; and (ii) strengthen the balance of payments.

title: Credit Program Production Development and Employment in San Juan Province
description: The main objective (goal) of the Program is to support the economic development of the Province of San Juan. The specific objective (purpose) is to strengthen the competitiveness of the Small and Medium Enterprises of the Province in local and foreign markets by improving the access to financing and by promoting the development of the industry with a strong public-private relation.

title: Strengthening of Policies on Childhood, Adolescence, and Family
description: The program¿s development objective is to help increase the life skills of children and teenagers in their family and community environment in Argentina, particularly those from socially vulnerable households and communities. This objective can only be achieved through multiple government strategies and in the medium term. The nature of this operation (strengthening management, closing information gaps) and the amount delineate the program¿s contribution to this objective. Specifically, the purpose of the operation is to bolster the leadership function of the National Department for Childhood, Adolescence, and the Family (SENNAF) in the area of policies that target children and adolescents and their family environment, positioning it as a key lead agency for purposes of closing the gaps in sector knowledge and as the organizer of comprehensive public action on the subnational level.

title: Program for Strengthening and Integration of Health Networks in the Province of Buenos Aires - PROFIR II
description: The objective of the second individual loan operation under the CCLIP is to improve the accessibility and the effective coverage of the public health services for the population of the PBA. The specific development objectives are: (i) improve the accessibility and effectiveness of public health services at the primary care level; (ii) improve the effectiveness and integration of health services networks; and (iii) expand the provisioning capacity for the prevention, detection and care of COVID-19.

title: Program to Support Transparency and Integrity Reforms in Argentina
description: The objective of the program is to contribute to transparency and integrity through regulations and mechanisms that promote access to information in the following areas: (i) legal adoption of the principle of access to public information and ethical conduct of officials Public services; (Ii) the management of expenditure on works, contracting and government personnel; And (iii) management of the financial sector.

title: Provincial Fiscal Management Strengthening Program
description: The overall objective of the CCLIP and the first operation is to improve subnational fiscal sustainability in line with the parameters of the federal fiscal adjustment conducted in Argentina at the national level. The specific objectives are: (i) to increase the effectiveness of own-source revenue collection and rebalance the tax burden toward more efficient and less distortionary taxes, (ii) to increase expenditure efficiency, and (iii) to improve financial solvency.

title: Public Finance Management Sector
description:
The project would have three components:
1. Public Investment Strengthening, supporting the development of an integrated public investment management system, consistent with results based budgeting
2. Results based budgeting which would include budget management reforms in order to increase the coverage of the national busget system aned gear the system towards results based budgeting.
3. Public Debt management, which would include all necessary reforms to modernize public debt legislation and systems, required as a result of the profound changes in Argentinian debt in the past few years.

title: Railroad Gral Roca Improvement Program - Constitución - La Plata Line
description: The main objective of the program is to improve rail passenger transport service in the RMBA.

title: Program to Strengthen Federal Security in Argentina
description: Contribute to strengthening the capacity for strategic security management to prevent violence in Argentina

title: Provincial Management Strengthening Program II
description: The operation's general objective, in keeping with the goal of the CCLIP, is to contribute to provincial fiscal sustainability and growth by improving revenue, expenditure, and public investment and implementing investment projects. Its specific objectives at the provincial level are to increase: (i) less distortion revenue as a share of total revenue; (ii) the efficiency of public expenditure management; and (iii) public investment.

title: Program to Support the Policy on Improving Equity in Education - PROMEDU III
description: The objectives of the project are: (i) to help increase the coverage of early childhood and secondary education for the most vulnerable population; and (ii) to support the policy for primary and secondary school retention and quality.

title: Multisectoral Program to Strengthen the Public Investment Cycle
description: The program's general development objective is to enhance public investment efficiency at the different levels of government with the aim of promoting economic and social development, in accordance with the strategic priorities of the Argentine Republic. Its specific objectives are to: (i) increase the availability of viable, execution-ready public investment projects; (ii) narrow territorial coverage gaps with respect to available projects designed to promote territorial equity; and (iii) boost the efficacy of State actors by improving their capacity to manage the public investment project cycle at the various levels of government—national, provincial, and municipal.

title: Program to Support the Equity and Effectiveness of the Social Safety Net in Argentina -Phase II
description: The general objective of the program is to help make social safety net programs in Argentina sustainable and more effective. Specifically, the program seeks to: (i) ensure the sustainability of cash transfer programs aimed at the vulnerable population in the context of the targets agreed upon by the Argentine government and the International Monetary Fund; (ii) foster progression and continuity in education, as well as comprehensive vocational training for transfer beneficiaries; (iii) improve the distributive efficiency of subsidies on public transportation services; and (iv) enhance the efficiency of social safety net programs through better management of the data generated during program execution.

title: Program to Expand Capacity and Road Safety on Integration Road Corridors
description: The program's objective is to help make the economy of Argentina's central region more productive by improving road infrastructure. The specific objectives are to: (i) improve the quality of traffic flow on National Route 19 (RN 19) by expanding road capacity on the Monte Cristo–San Francisco segment, which will decrease travel times and transportation costs, enhance road safety, and possibly prevent weather-related road closures; and (ii) enhance road safety on the national road network (RVN) by developing public capacity to design and implement a nationwide road safety improvement program, which will increase the number of kilometers of the RVN designed to modern road safety standards.

title: Quality and Equity of Education. Promedu IV-
description: The goals include: (i) improve student achievement , (ii) improve retencion at all educational levels, (iii) improve monitoring and evaluation systems, (iv) increase access by building and equiping new schools in uncovered areas.

title: Barrio Improvement Program, Second Individual Operation
description: The objective of this operation is to improve the living conditions of households located in shantytowns and unregulated settlements in the country. This proposed second operation is framed by the CCLIP, which aims to improve the quality of life and contribute of the urban and social inclusion of Argentine households in the poorest segments of the population.

title: Program for Strengthen. Provincial. Inst & Fiscal Managem. Stage II (PROFIP II)
description: The program seeks to strengthen public institutions for decision-making based on performance and results information in national and subnational public management. Its specific objectives are: (i) to modernize the public financial and budget management system at institutions of the National Public Administration (APN); and (ii) to strengthen results-based management at subnational public and/or public-private entities.

title: Federal Security Program
description:
The program's overall objective is to help improve the effectiveness of MINSEG and of subnational governments
to reduce the number of murders and robberies in Argentina.
The specific objective is to help improve the effectiveness of MINSEG, federal forces, provincial police departments, and municipal
governments to reduce the number of (i) murders and (ii) robberies, initially in six priority departments: Morón and Tres de Febrero
(province of Buenos Aires); Santa Fe de la Vera Cruz (province of Santa Fe); Córdoba (the capital of the province of Córdoba);
Las Heras (province of Mendoza); and Comuna 7 – Bajo Flores (Autonomous City of Buenos Aires).

title: Program to support the social inclusion of people with disabilities
description: Reducing the levels of social exclusion of people with disabilities

title: Program for the Development of the Federal Optic Network (REFEFO)
description: The general objective of this program is to promote internet access and digitization in Argentina. To achieve this, the following specific objectives are established: (i) improve the infrastructure for digital connectivity in areas far from urban centers and increase the capacity of the national data center; and (ii) improve the digital capabilities of citizens in connected areas

title: CCLIP: Water and Sanitation for Small Communities
description: To increase, at the national level, the coverage of potable water and/or sewerage services, especially to sectors located away from urban centers, diminishing the incidence of waterborne diseases. To contribute to the sustainable environmental preservation trough the construction of sewerage and sewage treatment works avoiding surface and groundwater contamination. To reactivate the regional economies trough public works execution, contributing to the development and reactivation of small and medium companies and the generation of new jobs.

title: Program to Drive Growth
description: The objective of the program is to strengthen private and public investment in order to promote economic growth in Argentina. The specific objectives of the program are: (i) to increase private investment; and (ii) the modernization of the regulatory-institutional framework to improve efficiency in public investment.

title: Program to Support Integrated Public Expenditure Management
description: The main objective of this project will be to improve the efficiency and transparency of public expenditure through support for the use of information in decision making and citizen oversight. The specific objectives will be: (i) to improve the efficiency of national public expenditure by generating timely, comprehensive information to improve the execution of priority programs; and (ii) to increase access to budget information at the subnational level by strengthening financial information systems.

title: First Productive Road Infrastructure Program
description: The main objectives of the Program include: strengthening the provincial productive road networks, connect local production areas with the national highway network in order to improve access to consumer centers, improve regional interchange, support economic growth, consolidate the reactivation of the productive sector, contribute to reduce poverty and unemployment and strengthen the regional institutions in charge of the road sector.

title: Sustainability and Equity of Public Transport Support Project
description: The general objective is to support sustainable accessibility in public transportation for the vulnerable population to public health and education services, and to labor markets. The specific objectives are: (i) to support the affordability of Motor Public Transport (TPA) for the vulnerable population in Argentina; and (ii) to improve the sustainability of the TPA system in the AMBA.

title: Reconquista River Basin Environmental Sanitation Program
description: The objective of the program is to restore the environmental quality of the Reconquista River Basin (CRR) by implementing a comprehensive management plan that prioritizes leveraging actions in that regard. To motivate the population and include it in the program, priority will be given to investments aimed at those living in health risk areas. These investments will help to: (i) increase water, sewerage, and wastewater treatment coverage; (ii) enhance integrated solid waste management, primarily by closing open air dumps; (iii) improve connectivity and access to outlying neighborhoods located in hard-to-reach areas; and (iv) strengthen the operational management capacity of the Reconquista River Basin Committee (COMIREC) by developing management tools, which primarily include the Reconquista River Basin Comprehensive Management Plan (PGICRR).

title: Norte Grande Road Infrastructure Program III
description: The program's goal is to improve the accessibility, efficiency and safety of priority roads Provincial Road Network (VPN) in Great Northern Region (RNG), by expansion, rehabilitation and improvement of road corridors that connect production centers with local and external markets. The program also seeks to promote the sustainability of investments by incorporating the systems work financed road maintenance management. This objective contributes to sustainable economic development of the RNG.

title: Social Sector Program: Argentina Forward
description: The objectives will be to promote and support progress towards achieving the Millennium Development Goals , MDGs, by the Argentinean government, as well as to assist the government in meeting its financial obligations.

title: Extended School Day Program for Rio Negro Province
description: To improve the quality and the infrastructure of education in the Rio Negro Province

title: Federal Innovation Program (FIP)
description: The specific objectives are: (i) to increase private investment in innovation; (ii) to increase national knowledge production effort; (iii) to increase articulation between national innovation system (NIS) actors; and (iv) to improve institutional capacities to design and implement science, technology and innovation policies. The overall objective of this programme is to strengthen the capacities of public and private actors in the NIS to improve business productivity and to strengthen the capacity to address the challenges facing the Argentine Republic.

title: Program to Support the Digital Transformation of MSMEs To Industry 4.0
description: The general objective is to contribute to the digital transformation of the micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs).

title: Productive Development and Competitiveness in Mendoza Province
description: The final objective is to contribute to an competitive provincial economic structure, through focus on value chains articulated in a strengthened public-private sector climate. The purpose is to increase the competitiveness of the value chains located in the seven productive circuits of the Province.

title: Competitiveness of Regional Economies
description: This operation will contribute to improve the competitiveness of local economic activities in lees developed regions of Argentina. It will finance activities to help local value chains to increase value added and employment.

title: Sustainable Fishery Development Program
description: This Program aims toward the sustainable management of fisheries resources in Argentina. Its objectives are: (i) improve capabilities of research, planning, administration, control and fiscalization of marine fishery resources with an ecosistemic approach; and (ii) support acuaculture development.

title: Strengthen the Agricultural Innovation System
description: The objective of the Program is to contribute to the improvement of the agrifood sector competitiveness. Program's purpose is the strengthening of the agricultural innovation system for generating and transfer new technologies.

title: “Program to Strengthen the Statistical Capacity of Argentina’s National Statistics and Census Institute (INDEC)
description:
To make INDEC-produced statistics more reliable, timely, and relevant to help improve public policy and
private-sector decision-making and enable the public to make full use of its right to public information.

title: Program to Support the National Early Childhood Plan and the Policy for Universalization of Early Childhood Education
description:
The multisector objective of the CCLIP is to help increase the number of children ages 0 to 5 with age-appropriate physical, language and communication, and socioemotional skills. The objective of the first operation under the CCLIP
is to increase the coverage of quality public services aimed at promoting the development of physical, language and communication, cognitive, and socioemotional skills among children ages 0 to 5

title: Program to Strengthen the National Institute of Social Services for Retirees and Pensioners
description: The General Development Objective of the Project is to contribute to improving the health-related quality of life of the population affiliated with the INSSJP. The Specific Development Objective of the project is to reduce the gaps in the timeliness and quality of health care and services for the population affiliated with the INSSJP.

title: Water and Sanitation for the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area
description: The objective of the second program is to improve and expand water and sanitation services in the Buenos Aires metropolitan area and conurbation. The second program under the credit line will improve the reliability of the water treatment and distribution system, reduce physical losses, expand sewerage services, and increase wastewater conveyance and treatment capacity. It will also monitor the appropriate implementation of the executing agency¿s strategic and financial plan.

title: Strengthen Educational Trajectories in the Province of Buenos Aires
description: The general objective is to contribute to the strengthening of the educational trajectories of boys, girls, adolescents and young people (BGAaYP) in the Buenos Aires Province.

title: Road safety program in the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area
description: Improve accesibility to jobs and social services as well as road safety conditions in the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area

title: Program for road infrastructure to support production phase III
description: Improve the condition of provincial roads that underpin Argentina's main productive sectors

title: Emergency program in response to the Puyehue Volcan eruption
description: Restore basic public services to normalize economic activity in areas affected by the Puyehue volcano

title: Sustainable Development Tourism Sector in Salta Province
description: The objective of the program will be to increase the income and employment generated by tourism in the Province, and to achieve a more equitable distribution of both in the territory and population.

title: MSME Competitiveness Support Program
description: The program's objective is to increase the productivity level of the micro, small, and medium size enterprises in Argentina.

title: Innovation Program for Crisis Response and Strategic Priorities Management
description: Improve the effectiveness in the coordination and management of government priorities, by strengthening key functions of the Government Center. The described objective includes the improvement of: (i) tools for prioritization and planning of government priorities, methodologies for horizontal and vertical coordination to align policies and programs with government priorities, tools for using data for the design and monitoring of policies and programs that contribute to government priorities; and (ii) strengthen innovation capacities and promote innovative practices in public management, the private sector, and civil society to respond to the crisis and its consequences.

title: FIRST OPERATION OF THE URBAN INTEGRATION AND SOCIAL AND EDUCATIONAL INCLUSION PROGRAM IN THE AUTONOMOUS CITY OF BUENOS AIRES
description: The objective of the first operation is to contribute to: (i) the integration of B31 by providing urban infrastructure, quality social facilities, and improved habitability for housing and businesses; and (ii) greater educational quality and equity in the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires by increasing access to new educational tools and strengthening management and evaluation systems.

title: Global Credit Program for Reactivation of the Productive Sector
description: The general objective of this reformulation is to support the sustainability of Micro, Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (MSMEs) as a support for employment in Argentina in the context of the crisis generated by the COVID-19 pandemic. The specific objectives are: (i) to support the short-term financial sustainability of MSMEs; and (ii) promote the economic recovery of MSMEs through access to productive financing.ve financing

title: WATER AND SANITATION PROGRAM FOR THE BUENOS AIRES METROPOLITAN AREA AND CONURBATION
description:
The objective of the program is to improve and expand water and sanitation services in the Autonomous
City of Buenos Aires and municipios of the Buenos Aires Conurbation. The third operation under the line of credit will enhance the
reliability of the water treatment and distribution system, reduce physical losses, expand sewerage services, and increase wastewater
treatment capacity.

title: Fiscal Policy Strengthening Program II
description: The general development objective of the program is to contribute to the fiscal sustainability of Argentina. The specific development objectives will be: (i) increase the efficiency of the tax system; and (ii) increase the allocative efficiency of public spending.

title: Water and Sanitation Program for the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area and the Districts in the First, Second, and Third Rings of the Buenos Aires Conurbation”
description: The objective of the CCLIP is to expand the coverage and improve the quality of water and sanitation services in the Metropolitan Area of the City of Buenos Aires and districts in the first, second, and third rings of the Buenos Aires Conurbation. The objective of the first operation under the CCLIP will be to expand sanitation services, increase the availability of water, and improve the environmental conditions of the River Plate, by increasing dilution of wastewater discharge.

title: Neighborhood Improvement Program Third Individual Operation
description: The objective of this operation is to improve the habitability of households located in shantytowns and unregulated settlements in the country. This proposed third individual operation is framed by the CCLIP, which aims to improve the quality of life and contribute to the urban and social inclusion of Argentine households in the poorest segments of the population

title: Federal Tax Administration Reform Program
description: The general objective of the operation is to improve the efficiency of tax collection in Argentina. Specific objectives include: a) strengthen ARCA's organizational structure; b) support the improvement of the digital maturity of the tax and customs administration; c) support the strengthening of ARCA's human talent.

title: Technological Innovation Program II
description: To strengthen the technological development in key sectors for sustainable national development and strengthening the National Innovation System. OBE: Expand investment in R + D + I in the areas of sustainable energy, health, agribusiness and social programs, as well as new areas identified by the GOA. Specific Objective: Expand investment in R + D + I in the areas of sustainable energy, health, agribusiness and social programs, as well as new areas identified by the GOA.

title: Provincial Agricultural Services Program - PROSAP III
description: This Program contributes towards rural regional economies development, trough enhancing their competitiveness and agricultural exports participation. Purpose of the second individual operation of CCLIP is to enhance agricultural productivity, reducing agricultural losses and/or increase of agricultural sales from the ruarl producers benefetid by the projects involved in the areas of basic infrastructure, agricultural services and agribusinesses.

title: PHASE TWO OF THE PROGRAM TO BUILD CAPACITY AND IMPROVE SAFETY ON THE ACCESSES TO THE CRISTO REDENTOR BORDER CROSSING
description: The overall objective of the Conditional Credit Line for Investment Projects (CCLIP) is to help enhance cross-border integration between Chile and Argentina by reducing travel times and transportation costs on the Cristo Redentor System Corridor (CRSC) through the provision of transportation infrastructure and a border integration system to facilitate regional connectivity.The specific objective of the second operation is to improve service quality on the CRSC by reducing travel times and transportation costs. This will be achieved by expanding the Caracoles Tunnel, retrofitting the Cristo Redentor Tunnel, constructing bypass roads in urban areas, implementing rehabilitation of works, expanding capacity, improving road safety, and implementing a corridor management system.

title: General San Martín Railroad Improvement Project: Retiro-Pilar Branch Line
description:
The general objectives of the project are to: (i) help increase productivity through the provision of rail infrastructure, thereby improving the quality and capacity of the public transportation service in the northwestern corridor of the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area (AMBA); (ii) help mitigate the effects of climate change; and (iii) help reduce social inequality by providing quality transportation services to vulnerable groups.
The project's specific objective is to improve the quality of public transportation through the renovation and electrification of the passenger rail service of the General San Martín Railroad (FCSM) in the section between the Retiro and Pilar stations, which will reduce travel times, improve the reliability of service, and decrease greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Program to Support Argentina's Social Protection and Inclusion System - Phase I
description: To streamline the Social Expenditure of income transfer programs of the Social Protection System in both its contributory system as in the non-contributory.

title: Productive and Tourism Infrastructure Program for the Province of Río Negro
description: The Project's goals are to consolidate the productive and tourism sectors development, through the strengthening and expansion of the public economic infrastructure and the good practices applied in their management.

title: Program for Institutional Strengthening of the Ministry of Finance
description:
The program's general objective is to increase the influence of economic policy on
